primary_sources.title: Hermes Trismegistus and Hermetic Tradition
primary_sources.summary: Legendary figure attributed with founding Hermetic philosophy and alchemy
primary_sources.content: Hermes Trismegistus ('Thrice-Greatest Hermes') is the legendary author of the Hermetic Corpus, a collection of philosophical and religious texts that form the foundation of Hermeticism. These writings synthesize Greek philosophy, Egyptian religion, and Platonic thought into a unified system of spiritual understanding.

primary_sources.title: The Emerald Tablet
primary_sources.summary: Foundational alchemical text containing core Hermetic principles
primary_sources.content: The Emerald Tablet is the most famous Hermetic text, containing the fundamental principles of alchemy and spiritual transformation. Its central axiom 'As above, so below' expresses the correspondence between macrocosm and microcosm, establishing the foundation for analogical thinking in Western esotericism.

primary_sources.title: Seven Hermetic Principles
primary_sources.summary: Core philosophical laws governing reality according to Hermetic teaching
primary_sources.content: The Seven Hermetic Principles are fundamental laws that govern all existence: Mentalism (all is mind), Correspondence (as above, so below), Vibration (nothing rests), Polarity (everything is dual), Rhythm (everything flows), Cause and Effect (every effect has a cause), and Gender (everything has masculine and feminine principles).

academic_sources.title: Principle of Mentalism
academic_sources.summary: The universe is mental in nature, existing as thoughts in the Universal Mind
academic_sources.content: The Principle of Mentalism states 'THE ALL IS MIND; The Universe is Mental.' This principle establishes that all of reality is fundamentally mental in nature, created and sustained by universal consciousness. Individual minds are finite expressions of the infinite Universal Mind.

academic_sources.title: Principle of Correspondence
academic_sources.summary: Harmony between different planes of existence enables understanding
academic_sources.content: The Principle of Correspondence reveals the harmony between the Mental, Astral, and Physical planes of existence. By understanding patterns on one plane, we can comprehend similar patterns on other planes, making this principle essential for magical practice and philosophical understanding.

academic_sources.title: Principle of Vibration
academic_sources.summary: Everything is in constant motion and vibrational activity
academic_sources.content: The Principle of Vibration states that nothing rests and everything moves and vibrates. Different manifestations of matter, energy, mind, and spirit are simply varying rates of vibration. Understanding this principle enables mental transmutation and conscious transformation.

supplementary_sources.title: Principle of Polarity
supplementary_sources.summary: Opposites are identical in nature but different in degree
supplementary_sources.content: The Principle of Polarity reveals that apparent opposites are actually two extremes of the same thing. Hot and cold are both degrees of temperature, love and hate are degrees of feeling. This understanding enables the transmutation of unwanted mental states.

supplementary_sources.title: Hermetic Alchemy and Transformation
supplementary_sources.summary: Spiritual and material transformation through Hermetic principles
supplementary_sources.content: Hermetic alchemy applies the Seven Principles to achieve both spiritual and material transformation. The Great Work involves purifying consciousness and achieving union with the divine, while also understanding the laws governing physical transformation and manifestation.
